description: Accountability Pal monitors Internet usage and sends e-mail reports to accountability partners.  It is designed to be run on a server.  It is incomplete, and was last updated in 2005.
features: abandoned accountability dead gateway incomplete monitoring network opensource
name: accountabilitypal

description: Accountable2You originated as a personal replacement for other, slower, accountability software and has since blossomed into a product in its own right.  The product site and product interface are quite nice.
name: Accountable2You

description: Can optionally use AdBlockPlus filters and optional low bandwidth (no-image and no-javascript) mode.
name: Atlas Web Browser

description: Block.si is a Firefox and Chrome extension that blocks content according to categories that are controlled by the end-user, parent, or overlord depending on the device.
name: Block.si

description: The Blocksi router is a physical device intended to be installed as the network router at home for families.
name: Blocksi Router

description: A minimalist browser that uses few system resources and that blocks ads.
name: ButterFly Browser

description: The product is a physical router that "plugs in between your WiFi Router and your internet provider's modem".
features: biglist dns filtering gateway hardware network
name: Cedar Creek Filtering

description: Aimed at businesses, governments, and schools, ClearOS is designed to be installed on a router.  clearOS sells switches with ClearOS installed and calls them "appliances".  It is very similar to DansGuardian.
name: clearOS

description: ClearPlay is a service that filters out violence and sexual content from content purchased or rented on GooglePlay, or from special Blu-ray or DVD players.
name: ClearPlay

description: Cold Turkey is a relatively simple opensource filter designed to support self-control by allowing the end-user to configure times of the week during which to block access to certain websites.
name: Cold Turkey

description: ContentProtect is Net Nanny for businesses.
name: ContentProtect

description: CovenantEyes has a beautiful website with a lot of articles about pornography.  The site seems to target porn addicts and concerned parents with roughly equal emphasis.  The focus (and strength) of the software is accountability rather than filtering.
name: CovenantEyes

description: The suite includes Includes AccessPatrol, BrowseControl, BrowseReporter, and enPowerManager.  The products are sold to employers who want to control and monitor employees.
name: CurrentWare Suite

description: CustomBlocker filters any element on any web site with any conditionwith XPath and RegExp.
name: CustomBlocker

description: Designed to be used with the Simple DNS Plus (a DNS server), it is similar in approach to OpenDNS and NX Filter.  The 5 CYBERsitter lists are adult, malicious, k12, k12fun, and social networking.
name: Cybersitterlists

description: DansGuardian is/was a content filtering proxy that works in conjunction with another caching proxy such as Squid or Oops. It seems to be targeted primarily toward filtering internet content for organizations such as schools. A guide to setting it up for personal use can be found here. The last release was in 2013. See E2guardian.
features: abandoned filtering gateway historic more password proxy ratings smarts
name: DansGuardian

description: Distractus is a simple Firefox addon that allows the user to whitelist and blacklist sites using regular expression matching.
name: Distractus

description: DNSthingy is for Canadians, users of Clear OS, or those willing to flash their home router.
name: DNSthingy

description: e2guardian is a fork and continuation of DansGuardian.  It is an open source web content filter that filters based on many methods including phrase matching, request header, URL filtering, etc.  Unlike DansGuardian, e2guardian has some support for https filtering, if the necessary authoritative certificates are installed in the browser.
features: filtering gateway more proxy ratings smarts
name: E2guardian Web filtering

description: A text-only, no-image browser with javascript support, Emergency Browser allows one to use the Internet without images.  It has no built-in app-locking, but it could be paired with a standard app-locking program.
name: Emergency Browser

description: A very small ISP with a mishmash of filtering services for the very conservative.  The SafeSentryPro platform does html filtering.
name: emypeople.net

description: Launched in 2001 and last updated in September 2001, this appears to be a dead project.
name: eVision

description: A free web debugging proxy, this product is aimed at web developers, not general Internet consumers. Fiddler sets itself up as a WinINET Proxy [see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa384075(v=vs.85).aspx ], so it intercepts traffic from all applications that use WinINET (IE, Office).  It is more useful for developing a web application and web server; it is not a consumer-oriented filter.
name: Fiddler

description: Fortify is not a filter, but it is similar enough to warrant inclusion here.  Instead of filtering or monitoring, it aims to educate and support a porn user as he/she moves toward that goal.
name: Fortify

description: FoxFilter is an add-on to Firefox and Chrome designed to "protect children and teens from inappropriate content on the Web."  It only works in Firefox and Chrome.
name: FoxFilter

description: Formerly called Anti-Social Pro, the software is marketed towareds those seeking to avoid the distractions of the Internet.
name: Freedom

description: Supposedly designed with the "frum" community in mind.  Yet, it was built in Romania and seems to be sold to employers.
name: GenTech

description: Go to Play Store Settings. Select Content Filtering. Choose the maturity level as per you choice. -- http://www.lifehack.org/articles/technology/20-google-play-store-tips-and-tricks-you-cant-miss.html
name: Google Play Store
Green Dam Youth Escort (Mainland Chinese Government mandated software)

cost: free, but fines if you view porn
description: Guard your eyes is an online program, not a true filter.  Users pay fines every time they view porn.
name: Guard Your Eyes

description: A to-do app that helps the user form good habits.  Its tagline is 'gamify your life'
name: Habatica

description: Originally developed for Internet Cafes in Turkey.
name: Handy Filter

description: Activity Forensics is primarily spying software that logs computer use including keystrokes, screenshots, Internet activity, and other data.  It offers rudimentary filtering.
name: HomeGuard

description: Sold to companies for overlord-style filtering, Blue Coat (now part of Symantec) allows free use of the filter for individuals looking to protect themselves or their family.  It is configured using an administrative password.  The k9 administrator can view all previous internet activity in addition to changing which categories to block and which features to enable.
features: biglist countermeasures filtering monitoring password timer
name: K9 Web Protection

description: Project seems to have died in 2011
name: Kurupira

description: An Android browser with built-in ad-blocking.
name: Lightning Web Browser

description: Little Browser reduces data utilization by displaying only readable content from webpages and by not downloading extraneous contents like scripts and images.
name: Little Web Browser

features: filtering hardware mimetypes network smarts timer
name: livigent

description: Mac OS X Parental Controls can operate in three modes: unrestricted, automatic, and whitelist.
name: Mac OS X Parental Controls
MobiCIP
platform: android chromeos ios kindle macosx nook windows

description: A browser that uses a privacy-conserving configuration, Naked Browser seems to have been written for the author's own use and then shared with the world.
name: Naked Browser

description: Kosher Internet, uses Seimen technologies
name: NativUSA

description: Net Angel sells home routers that have e2guardian pre-installed.  Whenever a website is blocked, a text message is sent to a phone number.  As of 2016-11-11, the company also has beta-quality iOS and Android apps that will feature similar techniques.
name: Net Angel

features: accountability biglist filtering monitoring social timer
name: Net Nanny

description: Net Responsibility monitors Internet usage and sends e-mail reports to accountability partners. Must be compiled from source on Mac OS X and Ubuntu 14.10 or above (see this thread). A build script can be found here.
name: Net Responsibility

description: Norton Family has free and paid offerings, both of which are aimed at parents who want to know what their children are doing online.
name: Norton Family

description: A DNS-based filter and monitor, similar to OpenDNS, but with user-authentication capability for user-specific rules.
name: NX Filter

description: Free for home use, OpenDNS is both easy-to-use and popular.
name: OpenDNS
platform: android ios linux macosx network windows

name: Parental Controls and Web Filter from MetaCert

description: Parenteeno monitors what the user (i.e., child) does on the target device and sends the data to the Parenteeno servers where reports are prepared for parental review.  The product is created by 2 dads in Dublin and the product page says it is all about protecting children from "cyberbullying, sexting, predators and other menace."
name: Parenteeno

features: abandoned dead filtering mia monitoring screenshots scuzzy spying
name: Partner Guard

description: PicBlock is one of the few filters that attempts to detect skin tones.  The project was last updated in 2011.
name: PicBlock

description: Requires user play a certain amount of educational games to unlock other apps.
name: Play This 2 Play That

description: Customizable, but blocks all images from the internet by default.  Its delayed-configuration system is designed to bolster self-control on the Internet.  Pluckeye on Android is a text-only browser with fewer features than desktop Pluckeye.
features: changedelay filtering mimetypes monitoring opensource-contrib timer
name: Pluckeye

description: Privoxy is a non-caching web proxy designed to enhance privacy, control access, and remove ads.
name: Privoxy

description: A Firefox extension, the ProCon Latte Content Filter blocks (usually containing pornography) based on simple keyword lists.  It supports password protection, and it can be configured to only allow whitelisted sites.
name: ProCon Latte Content Filter

cost: free but prompts user to install AdBeaver adware
description: Public Fox can block downloads, prevent browser changes, lock down addons, bookmarks, and more, block unwanted web sites.
name: Public Fox

description: Qustodio appears to be a complete filtering/monitoring package.  Aimed primarily at parents and schools, it boasts that its "smart internet filters scans web content in real time".  There are some rumors it hampers the Internet experience of folks who have slow Internet connections.
features: filtering locationtracking monitoring smarts spying timer
name: Qustodio

description: Designed for accountability, recoveryBox, the iOS Mobile App for Addiction Recovery, is an iOS app toolset that facilitates tracking of daily life activities and gaining insight into why you do what you do.  Similar to R|Tribe.
name: recoveryBox

description: R|Tribe is an app for mobile devices that attempts to assist users in "interrupting the addiction cycle."  Through in-app connections to friends (i.e., reports), and self-tracking of recovery, the user gains knowledge about their own addiction cycle and is assisted in finding ways to break it.
name: R|Tribe

description: Dead as of 2013.
features: ailing dead filtering historic monitoring timer
name: Safe Eyes

description: Designed for organizations, the minimum system requires for SafeSquid are 2GB of ram and 2 CPU cores.
name: SafeSquid

cost: free with registration or pay what you want
description: A DNS service for families with children.  The service is pay what you want with registration.
name: Safesurfer

description: Perfect for the scientologist overlord.  Merely amusing for all others.
name: Scieno Sitter

description: The purpose of the program is to block access to certain web sites (Blacklist) for a period of time with no easy way to unblock access.  It was last updated in 2010.
name: SelfControl for Linux

description: SelfControl is an open source project, the purpose of which is to allow the user to block access to websites (or mail servers) for a predetermined period of time.
name: SelfControl for Mac

description: SelfRestraint is a cross platform application which blocks access to websites for a predetermined period of time.  It was inspired by SelfControl.
name: SelfRestraint

description: Silent Block is a Firefox addon that uses url regular expression to whitelist or blacklist sites.
name: Silent Block

description: SPIN is a browser with built-in filtering.  It has 4.2 stars in the Android store.
name: SPIN Safe Browser

description: Squidblacklist (SBL) is a publisher of blacklists for web filtering platforms.
name: Squidblacklist.org

description: A URL redirector that can be used with the Squid proxy and that supports large blacklists (altough DansGuardian claims to be significantly faster).  It has seen very little modification in recent years.
name: SquidGuard

description: StayFocusd is a Chrome plugin that can block "time wasting" websites.  It only works in Chrome.
name: StayFocusd

description: A to-do app that helps the user form good habits.
name: Streaks

description: A very small text-only browser for Android.  It is reminiscent of lynx.
name: TextBrowser

description: A browser that reduces data usage by displaying only readable content from web pages.  Ads, images, and scripts are not loaded.
name: TextOnly Reader Pro

description: Originally founded as a dial up ISP back in the late 90s, True Vine now offers the TVO Blockit kit to filter the Internet from a "Christian perspective."  The company formerly used FilterPak.
name: True Vine Online

description: With UBhind, you can once and for all curb your smartphone overuse and regain control of your productivities!
name: UBhind

description: URLFilterService works categorizes sites using Shalla Secure Service and Universit√© Toulouse 1 Capitole url listings.  The installation video shows that one must disable default Windows security in order to install it, and the FAQ says, "Use it at your own risk."  Indeed.
name: URLFilterService

description: Provides an easy way to comply with the Children's Internet Proetection Act (CIPA)
name: UserGate

description: Used for spying on employees.

description: The Victory App is a combination electronic journal, calendar, and book intended to help the user quit porn.
name: Victory App

description: Like DansGuardian, but also works with https.  The project will target the Raspberry PI as an installation platform.
name: Web Safety for Squid Proxy (qlproxy)

description: A proxy-based project that appears to be abandoned.  It was last updated in 2010.
name: WebCleaner

description: Lock your computer to a Web application.  Converts an ordinary computer to a kiosk.
name: Webconverger

description: A 2005 article by PhD students Mohamed Hammami of Ecole Centrale de Lyon in France and Liming Chen of Ecole Centrale de Lyon in France.  The company that published the article is http://www.idea-group.com/ and in 2016 offers SEO services.  It must not work.
name: WebGuard

description: The software tracks browsing so that parents can see what their children are doing online.  The stated goal of the product is to provide an incentive for children to behave online when they know that what they are doing will be seen by their parents.  To get the product, you need to give your full name and email address.
name: Webshadow

description: Parental Control by a whitelist of sites, admin is by password. We use this for young children to keep them on the sites we have pre approved. You can add new sites with the click of a button.
name: Whitelist Ninja

description: WOT is a browser plugin that displays a trust-level icon next to sites, based on input from users from around the world.  It works in Firefox, Chrome, Internet Explorer, and Opera.
name: WOT

description: Development of X3Watch seems to have ceased in 2017, and customers given the chance to transfer membership to EverAccountable.
name: X3Watch
